results.title: Conservation of natural resources
results.brief_description: The soil, the streams and lakes, and the forests are among our most vaulable natural resources, but in almost every continent human habitation has caused untold waste through thoughtless agricultural, pastoral, and mining activities. This film (produced in 1938) explains the seriousness of this waste, and shows some of the steps which are being taken in the USA to counteract the effects of wind and water erosion and the consequences of unwise farming and grazing, and it indicates the general principles which must be observed if the continent’s most valuable natural resources are to be conserved to benefit future generations!!

results.title: Conservation in the Snowy Mountains
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of soil conservation in the catchment areas of the Snowy Mountains and illustrates how erosion is being controlled. Erosion in the Snowy area is due to the removal of vegetation through excessive grazing, burning off and the construction of roads. Ways in which this is being handled are prevention of fires, re-vegetation, control of grazing, building of brush fences and matting, and contour ploughing.

results.title: Conservation in action
results.brief_description: Explains the program of the US Fish and Wildlife Service in conserving and managing national resources. Includes scenes showing habitat needs of salmon, waterfowl, buffalo, mountain goats and other forms of wildlife.

results.title: Conquest of the sea
results.brief_description: An exploration of the world under the water by aqua-lung divers near Adelaide in South Australia. This film shows glimpses of the unsurpassed beauty of underwater exploration, including sponges, red mullet, rock flathead, cowries, leather jackets and coral fish with long, narrow snouts. Wreck remains show that nature still challenges man.

results.title: The Conquest of the Pacific
results.creator_credit: Government of the Commonwealth of Australia
results.brief_description: A record of the arrival of Kingsford-Smith and Ulm at Brisbane on 9th June 1928, after their first successful flight across the Pacific and their official welcome in Sydney including Kingsford Smith’s broadcast greeting to the people.

results.title: Conquest of the dark
results.creator_credit: Douglas Clarke, Howard Thomas and Associated British-Pathe
results.brief_description: Through the story of one man who loses his sight and who, with expert and sympathetic training, finds self-confidence and financial independence, the film illustrates the work which organised welfare of the blind is doing in Britain. It emphasises that in selected occupations the blind person can compete on terms of equality with the sighted, and shows many aspects of industrial rehabilitation.

results.title: Conquest of Everest
results.creator_credit: Grahame Tharp, John Taylor, Leon Clore, Countrymen Productions and Group 3
results.brief_description: A record of the successful Everest expedition in 1953. Beginning with a brief account of earlier expeditions, this film shows the months of preparation, the arrival of the expedition party in Nepal, the hiring of the sherpas in Katmandu, the progress from one camp to another and the final assault by Hillary and Tenzing. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Conquest of a germ
results.creator_credit: John Eldridge, Donald Taylor and Gryphon Productions
results.brief_description: A dramatised tribute to the medical profession and, in particular, to the research workers whose efforts have produced so many valuable drugs and remedies which have revolutionised the treatment of pneumonia, child-birth fever, meningitis, and other diseases. Stars David Farrar.

results.title: Connemara and its ponies
results.brief_description: A visual essay on Connemara, situated on the west coast of Eire, in spring and autumn. Includes scenes of the wildlife, the ponies, and the life of the people on the farms.
